channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13147] Load actual META table descriptor, don't use statically defined one.
item.description:
In HBASE-13087 stumbled on the fact, that region servers don't see actual meta descriptor, they use their own, statically compiled.
Need to fix that.
item.summary: Load actual META table descriptor, don't use statically defined one.

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: loading meta table descriptor from hdfs, as other tables do.

This message is automatically generated.
Will this break things for people that have a very old meta table descriptor without the co-processors ?
It can. Lets add explicit check that meta have recent structure.

Elliott Clark I added code, that will compare meta descriptor on during master startup and will overwrite meta descriptor if it differs. So when region servers will reboot meta will be newly assigned to some other region server, and it should pick up new meta descriptor.
Does it sounds good?

adding code for overwriting meta descriptor if it differs.
added test for verify that it works.
the same for master branch

This message is automatically generated.

fixing tests
fixing HBaseTestingUtility, it should create root dir with meta table descriptor

Now meta is modifiable?

Bullk of patch looks good.

We don't need this anymore? This static definition? META_TABLE_NAME It is good that it is gone – now meta for sure dynamic.

no, Michael it is not yet modifiable.
it could be, but with mentioned issue with upgrades,
i made it nonmodifiable (i.e. master on start checks
that it not differ from what config denotes) and if
it differs it overrites it.

i think that next step could be some meta version, which
will help upgrade code to do right things (like it should
know how to upgrade meta between versions, like
database migration does). And when we will do that -
we can get truly modifiable meta.
+1 or master then.
retry

This message is automatically generated.

+1 on master (again).

We need extra checks added before we can add to branch-1.

Updated patch v5:

  • added value to descriptor holding meta version
  • now migration is a bit more intillegent, it compares versions and do minimal updates (for 1 -> 2, for any -> 2 it will just overwrite descriptor with latest one)
  • 1 is a version anything prior to this patch, so we always write new descriptor
  • 2 is a version with table family introduced (opens way to allow relatively safe rolling upgrades)
  • if master will try start with lesser version or region server will try to open newer meta, they will fail.

MetaMigration
Pls add proper InterfaceAudience and javadoc.

Not in this patch but a Q on existing code
For CATALOG_FAMILY family we have allowed user to configure the number of max versions but for the newly added TABLE_FAMILY HCD, it is again hard coded to 10. Why?

Doing more read on the patch.

Just change the doc around HConstant#META_VERSION - It speaks abt keeping the META version in the ROOT table. Instead we (will) rely on the meta version which comes from the HTD attributes.

On a side note (not your patch) we have HConstants with @InterfaceAudience.Public. I don't think we will need to expose these constants to user. These are used internally by us for different reasons. There might be other such constants also added to this. May be we will need another to Jira to clean up things. In the public exposed HConstant only keep things which need to be exposed. For sharing common constants (which are not be public exposed) let us have another constants file.

HTableDescriptor metaDescriptor = TableDescriptor.metaTableDescriptor(c)

This is still a static HTD. WHy?

Do we really need to add public APIs to HTD (which is client side public exposed)? Can we deal with getValue() only?

While creating the HTDs and TableDescriptors from reading from FS, we will call
HTD#convert(final TableSchema ts)
HTableDescriptor(final TableName name, HColumnDescriptor[] families)
setName(name);
setMetaFlags(this.name);
This contains code


byte[] version = getValue(META_VERSION_KEY);

      if (version == null) {

        setMetaVersion(HConstants.META_VERSION);

      }

So for old descriptor with no meta version in it, we consider as new version
Will the below code in MetaMigration will get used then?


 else if (current.getMetaVersion() < HConstants.META_VERSION) {

      LOG.info("Meta has different version, running migration "

               + current.getMetaVersion() + " -> " + HConstants.META_VERSION);

      MetaMigration.doMigration(fsd, current, compiledMetaDescriptor);

    }

Thank you Anoop Sam John for reviewing.

For CATALOG_FAMILY family we have allowed user to configure the number of max versions but for the newly added TABLE_FAMILY HCD, it is again hard coded to 10. Why?

Should be the same, will fix that.

But with this patch it is not relevant actually, Meta descriptor stored on disc and all settings are preserved.
So if you modify number of versions, they would be preserved between restarts and meta migrations.

Just change the doc around HConstant#META_VERSION - It speaks abt keeping the META version in the ROOT table. Instead we (will) rely on the meta version which comes from the HTD attributes.

It seems we need to file additional jira. There is a bunch of code which states that. This patch doesn't use this constant.
(for example HRegion#addRegionToMETA says about root too, which is incorrect and should be fixed).

May be we will need another to Jira to clean up things. In the public exposed HConstant only keep things which need to be exposed. For sharing common constants (which are not be public exposed) let us have another constants file.

Not sure that version is private (in compare to other exposed fields of meta). I'd keep that as is until we will really want to hide meta from user.

HTableDescriptor metaDescriptor = TableDescriptor.metaTableDescriptor(c)
This is still a static HTD. WHy?

No, it is not. It is created from config. Static method is for bootstrap, when we are formatting cluster
or repairing it in fsck. Otherwise with this patch htd from filesystem will be used.

Do we really need to add public APIs to HTD (which is client side public exposed)? Can we deal with getValue() only?

This method encapsulate logic for default version used. So it better to stick code locally.
But if there better alternative, can think about.

While creating the HTDs and TableDescriptors from reading from FS, we will call
....
So for old descriptor with no meta version in it, we consider as new version
Will the below code in MetaMigration will get used then?
else if (current.getMetaVersion() < HConstants.META_VERSION) {
...

Meta will not exist on filesystem without version. It was never created in such way
(it was always created on the fly), so this code is basically for future version
updates (meta will have version in it).
But it seems a place for bugs here, if meta will accidentally contain no version at all.
I think we need to handle no-version explicitly and take care of places where we
can allow no-version meta (it doesn't make sense actually, because without version
it is much safe to create new meta then trying to find out what this meta version is).
Thanks for pointing to that.

I may be wrong here but just asking


remove(META_VERSION_KEY);

MetaMigration.migrateMeta(fsd);

Just on master coming up we will do the migration?

bootstrap(rd, c);

There is some code called bootStrap in the MasterFileSystem. so if META is not found it will load only the new TableDescriptor for META with the new version in it right?

Thank you ramkrishna.s.vasudevan for looking at this thing.

remove(META_VERSION_KEY);

Yeah. That is to remove version from non-meta descriptors. But for now I'm thinking to make
field tableVersion visible to users. So user can use this version for its own
versioning if needed.
And we can use versions for other tables if needed.

Just on master coming up we will do the migration

yes, when master is starting and didn't found descriptor
it will upgrade meta. Next meta should be reassigned
to recent region server, and that is next jira i think, because
